abstracts.cdata!:
The Decentralized Electricity for
            Universal Access Project aims to increase affordable access
            to electricity in remote rural areas of Bolivia. This
            restructuring paper is for a second extension of the closing
            date of the $5.175 million Decentralized Electricity for
            Universal Access grant. The extension will be for 24 months
            (from June 30, 2011 to June 30, 2013). This restructuring
            will reallocate approximately US$100,000 from disbursement
            category two to disbursement category three. This change is
            due to: 1) a decrease in the cost of the items to be
            financed under category two since the bids for supplying
            Pico-Photovoltaic (PV) systems came in significantly less
            than expected, and 2) an increase in costs of category three
            for consultant services since the government will no longer
            have funds from the Decentralized Infrastructure for Rural
            Transformation (IDTR) project, which closed on May 27, 2011,
            to support the Project Implementation Unit (PIU).
